column1: You know, there's a lot of talk about how to keep the economy growing. [SEP] We talk about fiscal matters. [SEP] But perhaps the best way to keep jobs here in America and to keep this economy growing is to make sure our education system works. [SEP] I
column3: to Washington to solve problems. [SEP] And I saw a problem in the public education system in America. [SEP] They were just shuffling too many kids through the system, year after year, grade after grade, without learning the basics. [SEP] And so we said: Let's raise the standards. [SEP] We're spending more money, but let's raise the standards and measure early and solve problems now, before it's too late.

column1: Being lectured by the president on fiscal responsibility is a little bit like Tony Soprano talking to me about law and order in this country. [SEP] This president has taken a $5. [SEP] 6 trillion surplus and turned it into deficits as far as the eye can see.
